name: Path T Tongue Base
title: Pathologic T
notes:
**Note 1:**  The intrinsic muscles of tongue are four paired muscles within the tongue which control its shape.  The extrinsic muscles originate from structures outside the tongue and control its positioning.

**Note 2:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3. You may use a physician’s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. 
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX

**Note 3:**  Assign the appropriate T category (T1-T3) based on the tumor size for the following descriptions 

    Invasive tumor on one side confined to posterior one-third of tongue
       Lamina propria
       Submucosa
    Anterior two-thirds of tongue for base of tongue
    Base of tongue for lingual tonsil
    Base of tongue tumor crosses midline
    Floor of mouth
    Glossoepiglottic fold
    Glossopharyngeal fold
    Lateral pharyngeal wall
    Lingual tonsil for base of tongue
    Lower gingiva
    Midline tumor
    Musculature, intrinsic or NOS 
    Pharyngoepiglottic fold
    Soft palate, inferior surface or NOS including uvula
    Sublingual gland
    Tonsillar pillars and fossae
    Tumor of lingual tonsil on both sides
    Tonsils
    Vallecula

    Confined to base of tongue
    Localized, NOS
footnotes:
\* T4 [NOS] is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4 [NOS].
\# T4 [NOS] is not defined in AJCC 7th edition.
